subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] we have a hard row to hoe

Frank,
 
Point well made!
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s.comFrom: warrior18eii@...: Mon, 31 Dec 2007 06:54:04 -0800Subje=
ct: Re: [EVP-ITC] we have a hard row to hoe






No sniping needed! There =
were no thorns in my words. A lot of expression is lost or misunderstood in=
 email, if you took offense to anything I wrote, it was not meant that way.=
 I agree most people in the paranormal community (The Ghost Hunter generati=
on) do not have the understanding to grasp what we as a group are saying. I=
 have had endless arguments with paranormal investigators over this very su=
bject. Is it real or is it delusional rhetoric? To my knowledge no one has =
ever won that argument on either side of the coin. They say prove it, we sa=
y disprove it! With that being said, I am not a box researcher, I am an ITC=
 researcher. I use many methods to obtain the messages I get because the me=
ssage, not the equipment is what's important.Potential researchers will mak=
e their way to us at their own pace because we cannot force people to 'get =
it'. The connection we share with our spirit friends is through our hearts =
and spirits. Its a positive attitude, pure intent, desire and the will to c=
ommunicate that allows those switches to be flipped in our minds.I agree wi=
th you totally Bruce. We need more and more people with the above mentioned=
 attributes in this world let alone this field of research. Can we ever pro=
ve to anyone that this is real? No! Can we show them it is real? We can try=
! People may call me a defeatist for not promoting or defending ITC, but I =
don't think so. My original goal is not to convince the world that this is =
real. If they are supposed to "get it", they will.Best Regards,Frank R.
---=
-- Original Message ----From: bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@hotma=
il.com>To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.comSent: Monday, December 31, 2007 7:55:17 A=
MSubject: RE: [EVP-ITC] we have a hard row to hoe

Frank, This only becomes=
 an issue when new people get interested in our research and seek informati=
on from the usual paranormal community and are met with these type of answe=
rs and explanations. They quickly become disinterested and whenever anyone =
may mention box research in the future they convey the same closed minded i=
gnorance that was spewed to them on their initial quest for answers. Not to=
 mention that anyone that does any serious research in this medium would I'=
m sure like to have their efforts recognised as being legitimate in their s=
ource and taken seriously with respect. not  dismissed as nonsense or somet=
hing that is written off as fake or delusional.  Frank I don't want to star=
t a long thread with all different people sniping back and forth I posted t=
hat snip it of a blog to let everyone know what the general consensus of ou=
r research is. And I did not even mention who the blog was actually about b=
ut I'm sure we all can guess. It's that kind of stupidity that stops us fro=
m getting new potential researchers involved and adding their positive ener=
gy to our own, I have received messages from our friends on the other side =
that instruct that the more individuals that are involved and think positiv=
ely about the communication we are striving to achieve, the stronger the co=
mmunication will get. I view this blog attitude as not a personal attack on=
 what I am particularly doing but just another extremely large hurtle to ge=
t over in bringing this amazing form of spirit communication to the forefro=
nt of paranormal research. Bruce
Bruce Halliday 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .c=
omFrom: warrior18eii@ yahoo.comDate: Mon, 31 Dec 2007 05:18:29 -0800Subject=
: Re: [EVP-ITC] we have a hard row to hoe




Why would this be an issue? I=
 am not doing this to convince others of the validity of my messages. If so=
meone wants to learn how, I will teach them. If someone has questions I wil=
l answer them to the best of my ability. If someone is skeptical it is a di=
straction from my goals to try and convince them that something is real. It=
s pointless to try and convince or prove the reality of a practice that is =
so highly subjective and mostly personal.Regards,Frank R.
----- Original Me=
ssage ----From: bhali333 <paranormalinvestiga ting@hotmail. com>To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups .comSent: Sunday, December 30, 2007 3:18:44 PMSubject: [EVP-IT=
C] we have a hard row to hoe

This statement was taken from a blog that was=
 sent to me by steve. He came across it while web surfing.It is indicitive =
of the attitude 90% of the paranormal community has toward box evp research=
.I suggest we all memorise it because as box researchers this will be our m=
ost formitable object.The first thought that comes to mind about this whole=
 'box' thing is what are the chances that spirits would comunicate through =
such a box. I mean there are so many different radio frequencies the chance=
s that anything would or would want to use the am or fm bands seems very un=
likely. Bruce
